intro: Teclea myrei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. Teclea myrei thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its compact size and long-lasting blooms.
